   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(shell_docs_SUITE).
   22: -moduledoc false.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:    init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([render/1, links/1, normalize/1, render_prop/1,render_non_native/1, ansi/1, columns/1]).
   28: -export([render_function/1, render_type/1, render_callback/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([render_all/1, update_render/0, update_render/1]).
   31: 
   32: -export([execute/3]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap,{minutes,30}}].
   39: 
   40: all() ->
   41:     [ {group, render},
   42:       {group, prop},
   43:       {group, render_smoke},
   44:       ansi, columns
   45:     ].
   46: 
   47: 
   48: groups() ->
   49:     [ {prop,[],[render_prop]},
   50:       {render, [], [render, render_non_native, links, normalize]},
   51:       {render_smoke, [], [render_function, render_type, render_callback]}
   52:     ].
   53: 
   54: %% Include a spec here in order to test that specs of undocumented functions
   55: %% is rendered correctly.
   56: -spec init_per_suite(Config1) -> Config2 when
   57:       Config1 :: list({atom(),term()}),
   58:       Config2 :: list({atom(),term()}).
   59: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   60:     {ok, ?MODULE} = c:c(?MODULE,[debug_info]),
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   64:     ok.
   65: 
   66: init_per_group(prop, Config) ->
   67:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config);
   68: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_group(_GroupName, _Config) ->
   72:     ok.
   73: 
   74: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   75:     Env = [{App, Key, application:get_env(App, Key)}
   76:            || {App, Key} <- [{kernel, shell_docs_ansi},
   77:                              {stdlib, shell_docs_columns}]],
   78:     [{env, Env} | Config].
   79: 
   80: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   81:     lists:foreach(
   82:       fun({App, Key, undefined}) ->
   83:               application:unset_env(App, Key);
   84:          ({App, Key, {ok, Val}}) ->
   85:               application:set_env(App, Key, Val)
   86:       end,
   87:       proplists:get_value(env, Config)).
   88: 
   89: %% We keep the docs of a couple of complex modules
   90: %% in the data_dir in order to compare then with the original
   91: %% when we fix bugs so that we don't break anything.
   92: %%
   93: %% This testcase is always run so that we do now forget to
   94: %% check that any bugfix does not break the current behaviour.
   95: %%
   96: %% If you do a bugfix that does not break this testcase when
   97: %% fixed you should include that module in the list of modules
   98: %% tested.
   99: %%
  100: %% Currently the modules are:
  101: -define(RENDER_MODULES, [sofs, re, file, erlang, user_drv, ?MODULE]).
  102: %% If you need to update the definition because this
  103: %% testcase fails, just run update_render/0,1.
  104: render(Config) ->
  105: 
  106:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  107: 
  108:     lists:foreach(
  109:       fun(Module) ->
  110:               maps:map(
  111:                 fun(FName, Current) ->
  112:                         case file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir,FName)) of
  113:                             {ok, Original} when Original =:= Current ->
  114:                                 ok;
  115:                             {ok, Original} ->
  116:                                 ct:log("Original: ~n~ts",[Original]),
  117:                                 ct:log("Current : ~n~ts",[Current]),
  118:                                 ct:fail(output_changed);
  119:                             {error, enoent} ->
  120:                                 %% All modules are not available on all
  121:                                 %% platforms. For instance socket is not
  122:                                 %% available on windows.
  123:                                 ok
  124:                         end
  125:                 end, render_module(Module, DataDir))
  126:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  127: 
  128: update_render() ->
  129:     update_render(
  130:       filename:join([os:getenv("ERL_TOP"),
  131:                      "lib", "stdlib", "test", "shell_docs_SUITE_data"])).
  132: update_render(DataDir) ->
  133:     lists:foreach(
  134:       fun(Module) ->
  135:               case code:get_doc(Module) of
  136:                   {ok, Docs} ->
  137:                       NewEntries =
  138:                           case beam_lib:chunks(find_path(Module),[abstract_code]) of
  139:                               {ok,{Module,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,AST}}]}} ->
  140:                                   lists:map(fun({{Type, F, A}, Anno, Sig, #{} = Doc, Meta} = E) ->
  141: 
  142:                                                     case lists:search(
  143:                                                            fun({attribute, _, spec, {FA, _}}) when Type =:= function ->
  144:                                                                    FA =:= {F,A};
  145:                                                               ({attribute, _, What, {Name, _, Args}}) when What =:= Type; What =:= opaque andalso Type =:= type ->
  146:                                                                    {Name,length(Args)} =:= {F,A};
  147:                                                               (_) ->
  148:                                                                    false
  149:                                                            end, AST) of
  150:                                                         {value, Signature} ->
  151:                                                             {{Type, F, A}, Anno, Sig, Doc, Meta#{ specification => [Signature] }};
  152:                                                         _ -> throw({did_not_find, E})
  153:                                                     end;
  154:                                                (E) -> E
  155: 
  156:                                             end, Docs#docs_v1.docs);
  157:                               {ok,{shell_docs_SUITE,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} ->
  158:                                   Docs#docs_v1.docs
  159:                           end,
  160: 
  161:                       ok = file:write_file(
  162:                              filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1"),
  163:                              io_lib:format("~w.",[Docs#docs_v1{ docs = NewEntries }]));
  164:                   {error, _} ->
  165:                       ok
  166:               end,
  167:               maps:map(
  168:                 fun(FName, Output) ->
  169:                         ok = file:write_file(filename:join(DataDir, FName), Output)
  170:                 end, render_module(Module, DataDir))
  171:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  172: 
  173: find_path(Module) ->
  174:     maybe
  175:         preloaded ?= code:which(Module),
  176:         PreloadedPath = filename:join(code:lib_dir(erts),"ebin"),
  177:         filename:join(PreloadedPath, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam")
  178:     else
  179:         Other -> Other
  180:     end.
  181: 
  182: handle_error({error,_}) ->
  183:   ok;
  184: handle_error(Doc) ->
  185:   unicode:characters_to_binary(Doc).
  186: 
  187: only_if_smp(Func) ->
  188:     only_if_smp(4, Func).
  189: only_if_smp(Schedulers, Func) ->
  190:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  191:       N when N < Schedulers -> {skip,"Too few schedulers online"};
  192:       _ -> Func()
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: %%
  196: %% Render function
  197: %%
  198: %% This function tests that OTP code base can print its documentation
  199: %% in the shell. It is a time consuming operation that can take
  200: %% up-to 40 - 50 min if run in a single processor (1 scheduler config) machine.
  201: %%
  202: %% Skip the test case when running in a machine with not enough SMP.
  203: %%
  204: %% OBS. render_type/render_callback have shorter times and do not need
  205: %%      to be skipped, regardless of the number of available schedulers.
  206: %% 
  207: render_function(_Config) ->
  208:   only_if_smp(fun render_function_do/0).
  209: 
  210: render_function_do() ->
  211:     docsmap(
  212:       fun(Mod, D) ->
  213:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  214:               Exports = try Mod:module_info(exports)
  215:                         catch _:undef -> []
  216:                         end, %% nif file not available on this platform
  217:               pmap(
  218:                 fun(Config) ->
  219:                         try
  220:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Config)),
  221:                             [try
  222:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, F, A, DHTML, Config))
  223:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  224:                                      io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  225:                                                [Mod,F,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_doc(Mod,F,A)]),
  226:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  227:                              end || {F,A} <- Exports]
  228:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  229:                                 io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  230:                                 exit(R)
  231:                         end
  232:                 end, format_configurations())
  233:       end),
  234:     ok.
  235: 
  236: render_type(_Config) ->
  237:     docsmap(
  238:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  239:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  240:               pmap(
  241:                 fun(Config) ->
  242:                         try
  243:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Config)),
  244:                           [try
  245:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  246:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  247:                                io:format("Failed to render type ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  248:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_type_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  249:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  250:                            end || {{type,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  251:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  252:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  253:                             exit(R)
  254:                         end
  255:                 end, format_configurations())
  256:       end),
  257:   ok.
  258: 
  259: render_callback(_Config) ->
  260:     docsmap(
  261:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  262:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  263:               pmap(
  264:                 fun(Config) ->
  265:                         try
  266:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Config)),
  267:                           [try
  268:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  269:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  270:                                io:format("Failed to render callback ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  271:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_callback_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  272:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  273:                            end || {{callback,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  274:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  275:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  276:                             exit(R)
  277:                         end
  278:                 end, format_configurations())
  279:       end),
  280:     ok.
  281: 
  282: docsmap(Fun) ->
  283:   F = fun F({Mod,_,_}) ->
  284:             F(Mod);
  285:           F(Mod) when is_list(Mod) ->
  286:             F(list_to_atom(Mod));
  287:           F(Mod) ->
  288:             case code:get_doc(Mod) of
  289:               {error, missing} ->
  290:                 ok;
  291:               {error, cover_compiled} ->
  292:                 ok;
  293:               {error, E} when E =:= eperm; E =:= eacces; E =:= eio ->
  294:                 %% This can happen in BSD's for some reason...
  295:                 ok;
  296:               {error, eisdir} ->
  297:                 %% Uhm?
  298:                 ok;
  299:               {ok, Docs} ->
  300:                 try
  301:                   _ = Fun(Mod, Docs),
  302:                   {ok, self(), Mod}
  303:                 catch E:R:ST ->
  304:                     io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p:~p~n",[Mod,E,R,ST]),
  305:                     erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  306:                 end
  307:             end
  308:       end,
  309:   lists:foreach(F, code:all_available()),
  310:   ok.
  311: 
  312: 
  313: format_configurations() ->
  314:   [#{},
  315:    #{ ansi => false },
  316:    #{ ansi => true },
  317:    #{ columns => 5 },
  318:    #{ columns => 150 },
  319:    #{ encoding => unicode },
  320:    #{ encoding => latin1 }].
  321: 
  322: markdown_to_shelldoc(#docs_v1{format = Format}=Docs) ->
  323:     DefaultFormat = <<"text/markdown">>,
  324:     DFormat = binary_to_list(DefaultFormat),
  325:     case Format of
  326:         _ when Format =:= DefaultFormat orelse Format =:= DFormat ->
  327:             ModuleDoc = Docs#docs_v1.module_doc,
  328:             Doc = Docs#docs_v1.docs,
  329:             Docs#docs_v1{format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT,
  330:                          module_doc = process_moduledoc(ModuleDoc),
  331:                          docs = process_doc_attr(Doc)};
  332:         _  ->
  333:             Docs
  334:     end.
  335: 
  336: -spec process_moduledoc(Doc :: map() | none | hidden) -> map() | none | hidden.
  337: process_moduledoc(Doc) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  338:     Doc;
  339: process_moduledoc(Doc) when is_map(Doc) ->
  340:     maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc).
  341: 
  342: process_doc_attr(Doc) ->
  343:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Doc).
  344: 
  345: process_doc(Docs) when is_list(Docs) ->
  346:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Docs);
  347: process_doc({_At, _A, _S, Doc, _M}=Entry) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  348:     Entry;
  349: process_doc({Attributes, Anno, Signature, Doc, Metadata}) ->
  350:     Docs = maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc),
  351:     {Attributes, Anno, Signature, Docs, Metadata}.
  352: 
  353: 
  354: render_prop(Config) ->
  355: %    dbg:tracer(),dbg:p(all,c),dbg:tpl(shell_docs_prop,[]),
  356:     ct_property_test:quickcheck(
  357:       shell_docs_prop:prop_render(),Config).
  358: 
  359: links(_Config) ->
  360:     docsmap(
  361:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ module_doc = MDoc, docs = Docs, format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT }) ->
  362:               try
  363:                   [check_links(Mod, maps:get(<<"en">>,MDoc)) || MDoc =/= none, MDoc =/= hidden]
  364:               catch _E1:R1:ST1 ->
  365:                       io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  366:                                 [Mod,R1,ST1,MDoc]),
  367:                       erlang:raise(error,R1,ST1)
  368:               end,
  369:               [try
  370:                   check_links(Mod, D)
  371:                catch _E:R:ST ->
  372:                        io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  373:                                  [Mod,Kind,R,ST,D]),
  374:                        erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  375:                end || {Kind,_Anno,_Sig,#{ <<"en">> := D },_MD} <- Docs];
  376:          (Mod, #docs_v1{ format = Fmt }) ->
  377:               io:format("Skipping ~p because format is ~ts~n",
  378:                         [Mod, Fmt])
  379:       end).
  380: 
  381: check_links(Mod, [{a,Attr,C}|T]) ->
  382:     case proplists:get_value(rel,Attr) of
  383:         <<"https://erlang.org/doc/link/seemfa">> ->
  384:             case string:lexemes(proplists:get_value(href, Attr),":#/") of
  385:                 [_App,TargetMod,Func,Arity] ->
  386:                     case code:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod)) of
  387:                         {ok, _ModDoc} ->
  388:                             case shell_docs:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod),
  389:                                                     b2a(Func),
  390:                                                     binary_to_integer(Arity)) of
  391:                                 [] -> throw({could_not_find,b2a(TargetMod),
  392:                                                 b2a(Func),
  393:                                                 binary_to_integer(Arity)});
  394:                                 _Else  -> ok
  395:                             end;
  396:                         _Else ->
  397:                             throw({could_not_find, TargetMod, Attr})
  398:                     end;
  399:                 _Callback ->
  400:                     ok
  401:             end;
  402:         _OtherlinkType ->
  403:             ok
  404:     end,
  405:     check_links(Mod, C),
  406:     check_links(Mod, T);
  407: check_links(Mod, [{_,_,C}|T]) ->
  408:     check_links(Mod, C),
  409:     check_links(Mod, T);
  410: check_links(Mod, [C|T]) when is_binary(C) ->
  411:     check_links(Mod, T);
  412: check_links(_, []) ->
  413:     ok.
  414: 
  415: normalize(_Config) ->
  416:     ?assertMatch(
  417:        [{p,[],[{em,[],[<<"a ">>,{code,[],[<<"b ">>]},<<"c">>]}]}],
  418:        shell_docs:normalize([{p,[],[{em,[],[<<" a ">>,{code,[],[<<" b  ">>]},<<" c">>]}]}])
  419:       ),
  420:     ?assertMatch(
  421:        [{'div',[],[<<"!">>]}],
  422:        shell_docs:normalize([{'div',[],[{code,[],[<<" ">>,{i,[],[<<" ">>]}]},<<" !">>]}])
  423:       ),
  424:     ok.
  425: 
  426: %% Special binary_to_atom that deals with <<"'and'">>
  427: b2a(Bin) ->
  428:     case erl_scan:string(binary_to_list(Bin)) of
  429:         {ok,[{atom,_,A}],_} -> A;
  430:         {ok,[{A,_}],_} -> A
  431:     end.
  432: 
  433: %% Test rendering of non-native modules
  434: render_non_native(_Config) ->
  435:     Docs = #docs_v1{
  436:         anno = erl_anno:new(13),
  437:         beam_language = not_erlang,
  438:         format = <<"text/asciidoc">>,
  439:         module_doc = #{<<"en">> => <<"This is\n\npure text">>},
  440:         docs = []
  441:     },
  442: 
  443:     <<"\n\tnot_an_erlang_module\n\n"
  444:       "    This is\n"
  445:       "    \n"
  446:       "    pure text\n">> =
  447:         unicode:characters_to_binary(
  448:           shell_docs:render(not_an_erlang_module, Docs, #{ ansi => false })),
  449: 
  450:     ok.
  451: 
  452: %% Testing functions
  453: render_all(Dir) ->
  454:     file:make_dir(Dir),
  455:     %% We load all possible application in order to be able to use
  456:     %% application:get_application to get the application a module
  457:     %% belongs to.
  458:     PossibleApplications =
  459:         lists:flatmap(
  460:           fun(P) ->
  461:                   filelib:wildcard(filename:join(P, "*.app"))
  462:           end, code:get_path()),
  463:     [application:load(list_to_atom(filename:basename(filename:rootname(App)))) ||
  464:         App <- PossibleApplications],
  465:     docsmap(fun(Mod, D) ->
  466:                     maps:map(
  467:                       fun(FName, Value) ->
  468:                               file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, FName), Value)
  469:                       end, render_module(Mod, D))
  470:             end).
  471: 
  472: render_module(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  473:     put({shell_docs, nospecs}, non_existing),
  474:     Opts = #{ ansi => true, columns => 80, encoding => unicode },
  475:     case application:get_application(Mod) of
  476:         {ok, App} ->
  477:             App;
  478:         _ ->
  479:             App = unknown
  480:     end,
  481:     SMod = atom_to_list(App) ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Mod),
  482:     Files =
  483:         #{
  484:           SMod ++ ".txt" =>
  485:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Opts)),
  486:           SMod ++ "_type.txt" =>
  487:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Opts)),
  488:           SMod ++ "_cb.txt" =>
  489:                     unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Opts))
  490:          },
  491:     lists:foldl(
  492:       fun({_Type,_Anno,_Sig,none,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  493:               Acc;
  494:          ({{function,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  495:               FAName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_func.txt",
  496:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_func.txt",
  497:               FADocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts)),
  498:               FDocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, D, Opts)),
  499:               case string:equal(FADocs,FDocs) of
  500:                   true -> 
  501:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs };
  502:                   false ->
  503:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs,
  504:                             sanitize(FName) => FDocs}
  505:               end;
  506:          ({{type,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  507:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_type.txt",
  508:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  509:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))};
  510:          ({{callback,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  511:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_cb.txt",
  512:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  513:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))}
  514:       end, Files, Docs);
  515: render_module(Mod, Datadir) ->
  516:     {ok, [Docs]} = file:consult(filename:join(Datadir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".docs_v1")),
  517:     render_module(Mod, Docs).
  518: 
  519: sanitize(FName) ->
  520:     lists:foldl(
  521:       fun({Re,Replace}, Txt) ->
  522:               re:replace(Txt,Re,Replace,[global,{return,list}])
  523:       end, FName, [{"/","slash"},{":","colon"},
  524:                    {"\\*","star"},{"<","lt"},{">","gt"},{"=","eq"}]).
  525: 
  526: ansi(_Config) ->
  527:     {ok, Docs} = code:get_doc(?MODULE),
  528: 
  529:     HasESC =
  530:         fun(Config) ->
  531:                 Doc = shell_docs:render(?MODULE, Docs, Config),
  532:                 string:find(Doc, "\e") =/= nomatch
  533:         end,
  534: 
  535:     application:set_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, true),
  536:     ?assert(HasESC(#{})),
  537:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{ansi => false})),
  538:     ?assert(HasESC(#{ansi => true})),
  539: 
  540:     application:set_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, false),
  541:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{})),
  542:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{ansi => false})),
  543:     ?assert(HasESC(#{ansi => true})),
  544: 
  545:     ok.
  546: 
  547: -doc """
  548: Doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc.
  549: """.
  550: columns(_Config) ->
  551:     {ok, Docs} = code:get_doc(?MODULE),
  552: 
  553:     MaxColumns =
  554:         fun(Config0) ->
  555:                 Config = maps:merge(#{ansi => false}, Config0),
  556:                 Doc = shell_docs:render(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Docs, Config),
  557:                 Lines = string:split(Doc, "\n", all),
  558:                 lists:max(lists:map(fun string:length/1, Lines))
  559:         end,
  560: 
  561:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, 30),
  562:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) =< 30),
  563:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{columns => 20}) =< 20),
  564: 
  565:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, not_an_integer),
  566:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  567: 
  568:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, 0),
  569:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  570: 
  571:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, -30),
  572:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  573: 
  574:     application:unset_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns),
  575:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  576:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{columns => 20}) =< 20),
  577: 
  578:     ok.
  579: 
  580: %%
  581: %% Parallel map function.
  582: %%
  583: %% Parallel map function that discards the result of the function
  584: %% `F` applied to each of the items in `Ls`. It spawns as many
  585: %% processes as items there are in `Ls`. If the list is large,
  586: %% consider adding a set of working processes that round-robin on
  587: %% the job to do be done.
  588: %%
  589: %% - `F` is the function to perform
  590: %% - `Ls` the list of items to iterate on
  591: %%
  592: pmap(F, Ls) when is_function(F),
  593:                  is_list(Ls) ->
  594:   _ = lists:foreach(fun(Config) ->
  595:                         spawn_link(?MODULE, execute,[Config, F, self()])
  596:                    end, Ls),
  597:   ResponseCounter = length(Ls),
  598:   ok = sync(ResponseCounter),
  599:   ok.
  600: 
  601: execute(Item, F, Pid) ->
  602:   _ = F(Item),
  603:   Pid ! ok.
  604: 
  605: sync(0) ->
  606:   ok;
  607: sync(N) ->
  608:   receive
  609:     ok ->
  610:       sync(N-1)
  611:   end.
